description: Signals the user interface to display an error message. This can be a direct translation of a core system error or a summary of multiple, similar errors generated by the Throttler.

message.description: Optional. The primary, user-friendly error message to display. If omitted, a generic message may be generated from the 'details' object.

details.description: Optional. A flexible object containing supplementary technical information about the error, such as an HTTP status code, raw response, or stack trace. Used for generating developer-facing details and can serve as a source for creating a user-friendly message if the 'message' property is absent.

statusCode.description: An HTTP status code or other numerical error code.

message.description: A raw error message, often from an underlying system or library.

raw.description: The raw, unprocessed error data or response body.

url.description: The URL of the resource that produced the error, if applicable.
